intro: Camellia connata, commonly known as the Chinese camellia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, camellia-like flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters.
